keyMoments.title: Reveals Doflamingo's Curfew Between Humans and Toys
keyMoments.description: Thunder Soldier explains to Franky that Doflamingo imposed a strict curfew between humans and toys ten years ago when he took over Dressrosa.
keyMoments.significance: First major clue about the unnatural relationship between humans and toys on Dressrosa.

keyMoments.title: Reveals the Truth About Dressrosa's Toys
keyMoments.description: Thunder Soldier reveals the horrifying secret that every toy on the island was once a human who was transformed and forgotten by their loved ones.
keyMoments.significance: One of the most devastating reveals in the Dressrosa arc, exposing Doflamingo's cruelty and the true horror of Sugar's powers.
keyMoments.quote: Every toy in the island were once humans who became forgotten to their loved ones.

reveals.information: Explains that Doflamingo imposed a curfew between humans and toys
Reveals that all toys were once humans transformed and forgotten

keyMoments.title: Reveals 500 Dwarves Are Held Captive
keyMoments.description: Leo explains to Usopp and Robin that 500 Tontatta dwarves are held captive in Doflamingo's dark factory, including Princess Mansherry.
keyMoments.significance: Provides the dwarves' motivation for rebellion and introduces the importance of Princess Mansherry.
keyMoments.quote: 500 dwarves are held captive in the dark factory on Dressrosa, including the kingdom's princess, Mansherry.

keyMoments.title: Reveals SMILE Factory Location
keyMoments.description: Leo discloses that the dark factory is hidden in the basement directly beneath the Corrida Colosseum.
keyMoments.significance: Connects multiple storylines and reveals the factory's strategic location beneath Luffy's battle.
keyMoments.quote: The decisive battle will be in the dark factory, under the Corrida Colosseum!

reveals.information: Reveals that 500 dwarves including Princess Mansherry are held captive
Reveals the SMILE factory is beneath the Corrida Colosseum

keyMoments.title: Explains What It Means to Become Pirate King
keyMoments.description: Chinjao tells Luffy that the King of the Pirates must conquer all the conquerors in the New World, not just find the One Piece.
keyMoments.significance: Reframes the journey to Pirate King as a battle against all powerful individuals, emphasizing the competitive nature of the New World.
keyMoments.quote: The King of the Pirates is one who conquers all the conquerors in the New World!

keyMoments.title: Struggles with Memories of Garp
keyMoments.description: Chinjao cries as he struggles to remember what Garp did to him, demanding answers from Luffy about his grandfather's past actions.
keyMoments.significance: Reveals the depth of Chinjao's trauma and grudge against Garp, showing the lasting impact of Garp's legendary battles.

relationships.description: Chinjao holds a deep grudge against Garp for past actions, though he struggles to remember the details.

evolutionMoments.description: Chinjao cries while trying to remember what Garp did to him

reveals.information: Explains that becoming Pirate King means conquering all conquerors in the New World
Has traumatic memories involving Monkey D. Garp

name.japanese: トラファルガー・ロー

keyMoments.title: Struggles Against Fujitora and Doflamingo
keyMoments.description: Law is barely holding his defense against the combined assault of Admiral Fujitora and Warlord Doflamingo at Green Bit.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates the massive power gap and shows Law's desperate situation facing two overwhelming opponents.

keyMoments.title: Fails to Contact Nami
keyMoments.description: Law attempts to contact Nami via Den Den Mushi during the battle but fails to get through.
keyMoments.significance: Emphasizes Law's isolation and the communication breakdown in the alliance's plan.

keyMoments.title: Questions Missing Losers from Tournament
keyMoments.description: Vice Admiral Bastille becomes suspicious when no losers from the Battle Royales emerge from the colosseum and wonders about Maynard's silence.
keyMoments.significance: Foreshadows the dark truth about what happens to tournament losers and builds mystery around the colosseum.
